Description: The Rest on the Flight into Egypt; landscape with the Virgin and child sitting against a tree at left, the Infant John the Baptist and two putti playing with a lamb at right, Joseph asleep in background; after Peter Paul Rubens Woodcut (only line block)
Dimensions: Height: 451 millimetres (upper left corner made up)
Curator's comments: After the painting in Museo del Prado, Madrid, inv.no.P01561 (Rooses 179). The same composition attributed to Rubens' studio (but with figures of St George and other saints added) is in the National Gallery, London, inv.no.NG67. There is one proof of this woodcut with retouches by Rubens in Amsterdam and two in Paris.
Bibliographic references: Schneevoogt 1873 / Catalogue des estampes gravées d'après P.P.Rubens (25.114)
Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (4.II)
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Baptist (Prodromos)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: William Fawkener (with Philipe's oval stamp and the initials WF)
